casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellant, v. Baccus, Appellee.

[Cite as State v. Baccus, 105 Ohio St.3d 288, 2005-Ohio-1652.]

*289(No. 2004-2036 Submitted March 8, 2005 Decided April 20, 2005.) Joseph T. Deters, Hamilton County Prosecuting Attorney, and Thomas J. Boychan Jr., Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for appellant. Benjamin, Yocum & Heather, L.L.C., and Brian A. Lee, for appellee.

{¶ 1} The discretionary appeal is accepted.

{¶ 2} The judgment of the court of appeals is reversed, and the cause is remanded to the court of appeals for application of State v. Fraley, 105 Ohio St.3d 13, 2004-Ohio-7110, 821 N.E.2d 995, and consideration of appellee’s remaining assignments of error.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O’Connor and O’Donnell, JJ., concur. Lanzinger, J., dissents.
